subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests (was: TestNG 4 and Data Providers)
msgSnippet: ... With parameterised tests as well? It s possible in JUnit because the fact that the test instance is all that s needed - simply tell it to re-run again.
messageBody:
On 10/18/05, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 10/17/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Well... in most GUI JUnit runners (like the ones inside IDEs), you can
> > just click on the failing test and re-run it directly. This is
> > possible because JUnit uses seperate instances per test (mild dig at
> > Cedric)
>
>
> It's possible in TestNG just the same (not sure why the instantiation
> strategy has anything to do with this functionality?).

With parameterised tests as well?

It's possible in JUnit because the fact that the test instance is all
that's needed - simply tell it to re-run again. With TestNG, you would
need to know which of the various parameter values you wanted to
re-run the test with.

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
